Reviews.Title: “Every positive word travelers wrote is so true about T hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalaysiaGirls
Reviews.Content: You have to take the public buses to T hotel, Pok Fu Lam. Many buses from central go to pok fu lum. When u are in the bus there is a indicator to show u the next stop. When u reach pok fu lum reservoir , ring the bell, the next stop is pok fu Lum village. Cross the main road in front and the sign lead u to cuisine training school, VTC pokfuklum complex, guards are all there to guide u. Bus no. 40, 40M, 46x, 970,97o, 973 all go to pokfuklum. I travel mostly by 40m to LAN Kwai Fong, central and return the hotel late at night. No problem, very safe. Check in is smooth and room is spacious and the view is spectacular. When u r up the peak, u see the same view of the pokfulum side on the peak. I got a gigantic king size bed, soft linen. Fast wifi nice cookies. No tv paid channels , you got to watch live telecast at LAN Kwai fong which is a very short walk by bus. Octopus card is very useful and travel by bus is the cheapest, no doubt very often u got stuck in the jam. MTR is the fastest but lots of walking to the trains. Best to pay HK350 a day of traveling to cover whole of hong kong by the BIG BUS of HK.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: queenie113
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the T Hotel when I traveled to Hong Kong for a wedding/vacation. I've traveled extensively but can never ever say I've been given the royal treatment -until now. From the moment I arrived I felt special! Even though I was traveling solo I was given spacious accommodations (bath suite with separate tub and shower, king size bed, turn down service with cookies and chocolates every evening). The view was incredible,the best of both worlds, mountain and ocean views. The breakfast was very good, the staff friendly, reliable and very welcoming. The omelet station chef remembered exactly what I liked and would offer it every morning without my having to ask. When I decided the coffee was too strong the manager came to inquire if anything was wrong and offered me a latte which took care of the rest of the trip's caffeine requirements nicely : ) I went down to the lobby one morning to request a taxi and felt like a rock star, with staff falling over themselves to accommodate me, make me comfortable, keep me updated with the taxi arrival status. I almost had to pinch myself to ensure I was not dreaming! Some things to note: The hotel is in a quiet location, a little out of the way but makes for a restful, quiet evening. You will have to carry a card with the address for the taxi drivers to ensure you get back, and keep an eye out yourself sometimes for the Chinese Cuisine Cooking School sign so you do not pass the hotel. There is no pool either, which I know is important to some but did not bother me. They have a small gym but it is ample enough, and they also have yoga mats and free weights. Regrets: That I never had the time to eat there, except for breakfast. I understand the food is quite good. And my only other regret is that the spa was closed. I think that would have made the stay complete perfection!

Reviews.Title: “One word to describe: AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VivMart
Reviews.Content: Their service is the best we've ever received & we've been traveling for the past 12 years. Although most of them are students they give you the maximum attention. It's totally true they make you feel like a celebrity here. The concierge dept did an excellent job on helping us plan out our whole day in 30 min, on the contrary from other hotels in china who wasted 3hrs of our time just to reserve a car. This hotel is exceptional & we would definitely recommend it. No complaints here!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate K
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, son and I )have just returned to the UK after a 15 night stay at this exceptional hotel. We were visiting our daughter who lives and works in Hong Kong. The hotel comprises the 6th floor of an anonymous office building that is not well known to taxi drivers, so we suggest you print off the address and directions to get you there by cab. Once in the building the standard of decoration, fixtures, fittings and cleanliness are what you would expect from a high end hotel and the standard of service from everyone you meet surpasses any I have come across anywhere. Every staff member and trainee treats all guests like royalty, you will be greeted, doors opened, lifts called and your every request will be dealt with in a genuine desire to help in a kind and friendly manner. The rooms are large, well equipped and furnished. We had an ocean view room, with a glorious view that is shared by the deck alongside the dining room. The mini bar is well stocked and priced like a supermarket. You will have tea and coffee making facilities, an iron and ironing board, bath robes, a good room safe, free quality Wifi, international standard recharging facilities, LCD TV, including a small TV and waterproof remote in the bathroom and the best shower I have ever had in a hotel. Every evening the turn down service will leave slippers, cookies and chocolates, an ice bucket and a bath toy. All for a very reasonable and affordable price - believe me I did my research. The room price includes breakfast, unusual in itself. The breakfast buffet is extensive to suit both European/ American and Asian tastes and the service is impeccable. We ate there on several evenings at a reasonable price and while the menu was limited what we had was very good. If you stay over a Friday evening see if you can secure a table for their speciality banquet. This was held in the beautiful, traditional surroundings on the 8th floor and was a real treat, a set banquet of specialities from a region of China, Szechuan, in our case. Immaculate. Don't be concerned that the hotel is staffed by trainees, they are very well supervised and their willingness to learn and anxiety to help more than makes up for any nervousness. Also don't be concerned by the hotel's location. There is a bus stop just on the road outside the hotel. Buy an octopus card and experience Hong Kong's cheap and effective public transport system. We used it for ferries, buses, trams and the MTR without a hitch, including at the end of our stay the A10 airport express.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Hong kong”
Reviews.Author: Johan K
Reviews.Content: We staid for a 2 nights in the T hotel. We were extremely impressed with the rooms, the service and the food offered. The rooms were nice and extremely clean and worth a five star. We had dinner while the menu was limited, the food was excellent and in all terms well worth the money. My children were extremely impressed with the service and enjoyed the break fast buffet. it was very memorable and it is one best hotels I have staid in so far.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hidden gem of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Carebear79
Reviews.Content: The T-Hotel, Hong Kong [Hong Kong Island, Pok Fu Lam] I can be fussy & have expectations [higher than my budget!] but I really must speak highly of this hotel. T-Hotel is a training hotel which operates as a legitimate functioning hotel but is training staff through this process [always under supervision of experienced workers or managers]. I have TripAdvisor to thank for finding it & am very grateful that I did. Godwin Ho was the manager who was there on our arrival night & helped us throughout our stay. It is a very nicely appointed hotel which is around 10-15 minutes maximum from central Hong Kong island [and cabs are very affordable, mostly the cab trips cost us around $8-10 Australian dollars maximum at whatever time of day/night]. The hotel is not always easy to find initially, it may help you to state to cabbies that it is located next to the Chinese Culinary Training institute, you can also speak to their dispatch English speaking counterparts via 2way radios in the cabs]. As some have indicated perhaps it feels overly deferential at times with all the staff at hand to take care of needs but not suffocatingly so. The views of South China sea are very beautiful so if possible try to secure an ocean view room. There is a restaurant on the 6th floor whose breakfast is very good & they will also provide lunch & dinner from a set menu at very good prices. Also room service items were incredibly affordable compared to other mainstream commercial hotels. Overall I feel we were in for all intents & purposes in a very nice ‘normal’ hotel for a much reduced rate. By the way at one point we considered a suite [for approx $400 Australian a night] which is amazing, with amazing views. Do it for us, as we felt we couldn’t/shouldn’t afford it. PROS: Very good service. Free Wi-Fi. Only hotel including Harbour Grand, to offer ipod compatible speakers. Not fantastic sound though. Good location to be out of town yet accessible to it, & particularly the amazing views of South China Sea [if having ocean view room, or being in the restaurant]. There is a shopping centre with Western food choices inc Maccas/Pizza Hut not 1 kilometre behind the hotel. Very good food particularly buffet breakfast, with a decent range of Western options & a chef onhand to make eggs in whichever form you would prefer, scrambled, omelette etc]. Great views to enjoy any meal of the day with the option to sit outside on a parallel balcony. Good ‘Aqua’ toiletries. They also provided cute little rubber toys every day upon cleaning. Bathrooms also have a tv over bath which is nice, including a film window to reveal, or not, views to the room & outside if preferred. CONS: Connected to the good, & earnest, service, is the issue of language barriers, for instance my room service pasta one evening was an altogether wrong order. Although this could happen anywhere. Not great English tv options, although you can get by on Asian ‘pearl’ network which provided us some Hollywood options at night including Spiderman etc. A female manager tried to move us to another room [‘mountain view room which was more of a balcony than some low mountain behind] & was fairly brusque about it. The reason was due to a shower door which was getting stuck & leaking. She was more friendly & explanatory to my husband than myself; this is likely related to cultural reasons also where is it a more male dominated culture. Overall though, simply put, great hotel for great price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - great service, great room, great food!”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneGecko3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the T Hotel for a week in July 2012 and couldn't be happier with the place. Its cheap, great location, amazing view, attentive staff and perfect with an 18 month old baby. Fabulous cot was provided. We often ate in at the hotel and could not fault the food. Its cheap but top quality. I highly recommend the Peking Duck salad - cost about 8 AUD and we ate on the deck with a beer while watching the sun go down over the harbour. It is important to understand that this is a training hotel and the staff are nervous but attentive. Its important to be supportive. Anyhow, I would rather have attentive caring staff than a professional nonchalant person who is well established in the service industry. The only thing we missed in the height of HK summer is a pool. Its so hot in July that you really need a dip at the end of the day. BUT it is a short bus ride from Deep Water Bay and its really much cooler in Pokfulam than in the city. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Service as Service Should Be”
Reviews.Author: the_bear32792
Reviews.Content: The T, a training hotel afforded all the service and luxury one could want. The staff of trainees are under tight supervision for every detail of your stay. The rooms are five star and no detail is left un-noticed. As for price, it is the best in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMedicineMan
Reviews.Content: The other reviews have said it. But in brief, the rooms are great, the view is great, the service is a bit awkward due to the trainees but I don't mind that and sometimes it's even quirky in a fun way, the food is good, and the location is only good if it doesn't matter being away from the active downtown areas. I liked being in this quieter area. A few trainees were over eager which was uncomfortable but totally acceptable given that they are there to learn how to provide service at a high level. I'd stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a celeb”
Reviews.Author: SarElOzzie
Reviews.Content: I have no time for celebrities, but I have seen the way they are pampered and fawned over. I never expected to be treated like. A celebrity myself, but I think I now know what it would be like. The T hotel is amazing. The rooms are 5 star plus. I've done quite a bit of traveling and have lashed out for 5 star hotels, but nothing could have prepared me for the room at the T hotel. Other travellers have lavished praise on the quality already. I was blown away by the sheer opulence of the room, and the high tech gadgets. And the service from the staff!!! My wife and I were treated like royalty. This is a training hotel, and can accommodate up to 60 people, but tend to limit it to about 40 people. The students can't seem to do enough for you, and as long as you realize that they need the practice, it's just fantastic. True, the hotel is not in the bustleif the city, but the taxi is pretty good, and the view from the ceiling high windows is staggering. This is one hotel that I will definitely spend more time in.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dboxx
Reviews.Content: T hotel has the most amazing service and really strive to make your stay pleasing. The rooms were very clean, neat, and the turn down service was great. Breakfast was lovely, as was the view. The only slight problem we had was the language barrier with some of the trainees, and you need to have a bit of patience as they are all learning. Would definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: tenvsrini
Reviews.Content: Pros: This is a 5 star hotel at very affordable rates. Rooms are large, spotlessly clean and offer sweeping views of the ocean. Staff are extremely courteous. The hotel is not too crowded. We felt like we had the place to ourselves. Our son loved the animation projected on the corridor floors! Cons: The trainees can be a little short of confidence when conversing with guests - English knowledge is a definite problem - but more than make up for it with their eagerness to help. Their managers are readily accessible in any case. There is only one restaurant, with a limited choice of dishes. The hotel location does stump taxi drivers initially, but they should be able to locate it with a GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Loved very minute of our stay”
Reviews.Author: Dean66
Reviews.Content: We loved our three nights here - the trainees were so attentive if a little clumsy at times (completely understandable, they are learning after all) which all added to the charm of the place. Every request was handled diligently and earnestly. Rooms are very well appointed and the bed was the best we stayed in in six weeks of touring europe and asia - sooooo comfortable. Get a room with a view of the bay - beautiful. Food in the restaurant was OK, better dining options elsewhere. Breakfast is great. We got the A10 bus from the airport but you need to be really watching where you are going, it's very easy to miss the stop (we did). If we were to do it again, we would get the airport express to Central and then a $7AUD taxi to T Hotel (take the map from the website to help the driver). On the way back just reverse the process and check in your bags at the train station - couldn't be easier. It is a little bit out of the action but taxis are so cheap it's not really a problem

Reviews.Title: “One third of the price top service”
Reviews.Author: fabiofort
Reviews.Content: Training hotel! What a wonderful idea And it works! The rooms are impeccable, the service is excellent and attentive, for the money, less than 150 usdollars we had a five star experience. Location is not bad! Bus stop from the airport right outside the hotel, you do not evennneed to take a taxi from the airport, just catch A10 from the airport and in one hour you'll reach the hotel. To central it is a 20 minutes ride by bus.

Reviews.Title: “RECOMMEND! RECOMMEND!”
Reviews.Author: N0rza
Reviews.Content: After staying at a 5-Star Hotel at Macau I wasn't looking forward to booking in at the T-Hotel. Boy was I wrong. It was more than value for money. We stayed here for 2 nights. The harbor view rooms had a lovely view. The trainees at the hotel were wonderful. Some of them lack confidence but that has a lot to do with age and language. I called the concierge and the trainee did not understand me. But within seconds the instructor had sorted out my query. Catching taxis was great - the trainees provided great advice of where the best shopping spots are and instructed the drivers. The only downside would be the location. It was close getting to Central. But the "local" taxi drivers were reluctant to take us to Mong Kok (Ladies markets vicinity) and Disneyland. When we finally got a willing taxi driver they would add on $100- $140HKD to the fare without any explanation. Like everyone has previously posted. Catching a taxi - simply instruct them "cooking school Pok Fu Lam Road". I would highly recommend staying here. It is value for money. I loved the chocolates left in the room. Now sitting back at home with my momentum chocolate box purchased from the T-Hotel. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Find”
Reviews.Author: Squicker531
Reviews.Content: I recently spent five nights at this training hotel with a friend and we were both very impressed. Many fully fledged hotels could learn a lot from this place. Internally you will not find a more spacious and well appointed hotel in HK for the money, not even nearly. Food here is very good but more local offerings would be appreciated. We enjoyed their cocktails every night which are well priced and expertly made, being properly blended and most definitely potent! The staff cannot do enough for you and whilst the odd slip up is made, you have to remember this is a training hotel. Location-wise you will need to take a bus or taxi to most attractions and I guess I have to drop a point for this, but transport is so cheap in HK that this is not a problem. Really, please try this superb hotel as in doing so you are supporting the training of new tourist staff and you will absolutely love the place. Oh yes, I forgot, the harbour views from the rooms and balcony are breath-taking.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: NX622
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about booking this hotel, not so much for the service but the location. I needn’t have worried! My two night stay at the hotel was fantastic. I caught the express train to Hong Kong station and from there got a taxi to the hotel which was about a ten minute drive. I did carry a copy of the Hotels map located on their website and this was useful as although the driver knew the area he didn’t know the exact location of the hotel. There is a reception area on the ground floor but the actual hotel reception is on the 6th floor. Check in was quick (handy as I arrived after a much delayed flight) and straight to my room. The duty manager (Alan I think) was excellent; he showed me how to operate everything including the tv at the end of the bath! The room was very large, as was the bathroom and the bed was magical. I awoke the next morning, opened the curtains and was greeted by a stunning view of Waterfall Bay and the South China Sea with ships constantly coming and going. Breakfast was great with a good selection of predominantly western style food (cereals, juices, toast and hot dishes) but what was even better was sitting out in the open air on the balcony enjoying it with the same spectacular view as from my room! Transport. Getting around is very easy as taxis are readily available and so are the buses. Buses will take you to anywhere on the island (make sure you get an Octopus card at the airport!) which will in turn connect you to the ferries etc. I also got the bus out to Stanley market which is always good for souvenir hunting etc. Despite the staff being mostly trainees, they were always extremely pleasant and always trying their best. To be honest, I found them much better than many fully trained staff I have encountered over the years! Definitely one of the best hotels in Hong Kong and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “First Timers to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Rita P
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong was our stop-over for 4 days on a recent 8 weeks trip to Oz. I found this hotel via Tripadvisor website and it was by far one of the best we stayed in. Yes, the students are under going training and perhaps there is a need for them to understand a little more English. However, one must bear in mind that they are very young and what they lack in experience they certainly make up for in their enthusiasm to make their guests welcome. Having downloaded one simple page from the hotel website, we had no difficulty in finding it. We caught the City Bus at the Airport (A10) and two senior fares cost 48HK$ (approx. £4). All public transport is very cheap and from the bus stop outside the hotel we found it easy to travel around. Housekeeping standards in the hotel were very high indeed and the little touches the icing on the cake. We dined in the hotel every day and although the menu is understandably limited, the quality of the food we had was excellent and nicely presented. I believe that it would cost considerably more for the same accommodation in a 5 star hotel. With a little patience you most certainly will find the T-Hotel a very enjoyable experience. We hope to return to Hong Kong for a longer visit and will most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!!!! but be prepared for some interesting experiences”
Reviews.Author: ron1955goldcoast
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a nine day stay - the other 4 days were at Langham Place and subject of separate review. A bit hard to find, no signs but if you look for Chinese Training College sign you are there Firstly I will say that when you pay 50% of the rate of a normal 4-5 star hotel you cant expect it to 100% as good - but it comes so close. The rooms are spacious ,brand new and have everythng you would expect - Great view of the shipping channel for our room . Most of the fittings were good quality but not 5 star . Check in worked well , bags came quickly - so if you want to check in sleep and leave you have a great time . However if you want to eat in house be prepared for some things to go wrong . Cold food , Chips that came 30 mins after the main and some communication issues ,along with a fairly bland menu, on the plus side its so cheap , main course A$10,beer $2 , cocktails $3 bargain price even by HK standards. Some of the problems stem from lack of english with the students , no their fault perhaps the first 6 months of the course should be english . No one knew what Milk was??? The location will not suit everyone for us it was great we have been to HK 5 times so using the bus out the front to get to central was easy and its only A$7 in a cab TIP if you want a can get them to call one - extra $5HK - much quicker The students try their best and have big hearts and I really enjoyed the good and bad of this Sometimes they just dont use commonsense Overall I would go back in an instant - just great value - but I do want to mention a disturbing incident on checking out - in short the supervisor argued with us over a mini bar item worth 80 cents - even got the students to check the bin to see if there were 2 empty bottles - there was but one we had bought in so basically just after we paid a total of $13,000HK for 2 rooms - we were confronted over $6HK and my wife was accused of lying - Commonsense says even if the the guest is wrong you dont argue over such a tiny amount - I am writing to the management about this Despite this we will go back

Reviews.Title: “Trip Highlight !”
Reviews.Author: sporeantraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and the hotel was 1 of the highlights of our trip. The rooms are big, clean, new and well-furnished. The toilet had a long bath, a shower area and a TV! We stayed in a sea-view room and you really get an unblocked scenery of the ocean from the bed and we enjoyed watching these big birds ( couldnt tell what they were) soaring in the air every morning. We really liked the thoughtful touches: every night, we were delighted by 2 pieces of yummy choc truffles and cookies, well-placed towel-floor mat for each side of the bed; and a cute little rubber ducky/toy for the long bath. The chocolates were so good that we bought 1 box back for the family who also raved about them. They didnt sell the cookies otherwise we would have bought them too. The staff are young, earnest and smiley. What they lack in professionalism, they more than make up for, in their eagerness to please. Location was mentioned in other reviews as its disadvantage. However as this is not our first trip to Hong Kong so we found it to be a nice change to take the bus up - down the hill. The bus-stop is located just outside the Hotel and the sign board tells you clearly where the buses go to; we found many buses go to the major tourist locations. It is about 20 mins away from Central. It is true tho that you wont find any eateries or shopping around the hotel. We think this is a 5* hotel at 4* prices and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “DO believe all the amazing reviews!”
Reviews.Author: ilsalmi
Reviews.Content: The T hotel was an amazing experience and we were very happy with our stay. The previous reviewers said it all before, this truly is a hidden gem. The whole staff makes you feel welcome and they are so eager to please, the service is impeccable and the young trainees are such a nice change to be around from the somewhat starchy service in other top hotels. Breakfast is great - dim sum were either steamed buns or lo mai gai - the lotus leaf sticky rice wraps were actually better than at the Tim Ho Wan michelin star place in Kowloon. You also have american roasted breakfast, pastries, cereal, deli meats, cheese, fruits etc. all is delicious. the view from breakfast terrace is to die for, on a clear day you see all the island in the channel and ships approaching Victoria harbour. the transport to and from downtown was no problem, never you have to wait for more than few minutes, multiple buses serve Macau terminal, central and even Kowloon. on the way back we found the most convenient to get bus from central bus terminal ( exit A1 and the walkway), bus 71 in front of Western market across macau ferry terminal or green minibus 22 from Caine rd at the mid level escalators.

Reviews.Title: “Shhhhh.... don't tell anyone!”
Reviews.Author: biztrav77
Reviews.Content: You almost don't want to tell people about this place as it is sooo good. What everyone already said, the hotel is a training facility, however you hardly feel like a guinea pig, everything is top notch and the view is AMAZING. There is also a culinary institute attached as well as a western dinning society, the food is really very good - especially for the prices. The location maybe a bit out of the way, especially if you are a tourist, however it more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and experience!”
Reviews.Author: natalie g
Reviews.Content: My kids (20,17,14,9) loved this hotel so much that they did not want to leave to see Hong Kong. We let 2 of them stay one day and play video games in the room while the rest of us toured Hong Kong. They said it was their best day of the vacation. The hotel and staff are peaceful and you feel well cared for. They really focus on making sure you are happy. The rooms are fabulous and spotless. They have considered every detail for your comfort. There were lots of ooohs and ahhhs from the kids when we were showed our rooms. The taxi driver from the seaport seemed put out that we were going off the beaten path and kept telling us he had never heard of this hotel. He found it with no problem and the many times we went back and forth to Hong Kong, there were no problems either. The location is quite convenient and we were glad to stay here. It seemed just a 15 min ride to wherever we needed to go. The view at breakfast is fabulous. It is so nice that it makes you want to linger all day. Our rooms had a view of the other side which was also very nice. We came to Hong Kong thinking we were going to buy custom made suits. We did not feel these were a great deal and the quality we saw was not great either. My son had a fabulous silk and wool suit and 2 shirts made in Vietnam a month before for $80. Here the suits were $300 and up and not so nice. We decided not to waste our time. We found no great deals on shopping either. You can buy the same things in the US cheaper. The food is a good deal in Hong Kong and we loved that. My daughters had their long hair cut and styled at a salon for $12 each. They did a fantastic job so it was a great deal. We pay $50 each in the US for the same thing. We went up the long escalator to the mid cities and that is a trip not to miss. It was beautiful, scenic, and lush. We also visited the zoo and the children's museum and highly recommend them. I would skip having high tea at the Peninsula as many recommend. It is severely overpriced and the people who work there are pretentious. I was told I was not dressed appropriately as I had on a dressy pair of sandals (I knew not to wear flip flops). People in Hong Kong think feet are dirty and do not want to see them. Maybe this is why the Chinese used to bind feet...they don't like them. If I had on a pair of sneakers, I could have gotten in. We didn't want to after we saw the prices. We went instead for dim sum which was fabulous at a fraction of the cost. After a long day on our feet one of my daughters and I decided to get a foot massage. We found a nice little place in the main shopping area. During our massage the other girls working there started bringing nervous looking business men to the back rooms. We realized too late that the girls here were prostitutes. It is so unfortunate for the women (and children and families) of Hong Kong that this practice is so prevalent. It seems everyone here speaks English and they are very good to Americans. My girls became facebook friends with a young waiter who was excited to take photos with them to show his friends. It is the people of Hong Kong that make visiting so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The T Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanismom
Reviews.Content: While this is a training facility for future hotel staff we had wonderful service. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was wonderful, from a soaking tub with tv to a lovely separate shower with multiple shower heads.We had a lovely view of the China Sea. A very nice buffet breakfast was included in the price. The biggest draw back was the location as there isn't much around the area. There is a bus stop nearby and the hotel does provide 2 daily shuttles to the central area (you need reservations).

Reviews.Title: “T (is for Training) Hotel, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Sandysamnmynic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reached by an easy airport express train and short taxi ride. You will be greeted in the most professional manner and efficiently transferred to your large and beautifully appointed room which may overlook Hong Kong harbour. It is further east to the main city views but nevertheless the views are dramatic. A very impressive accommodation, maybe previously a well kept secret, but not any more!

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong's best secret”
Reviews.Author: LucyJK
Reviews.Content: I have family who live in this part of hong kong, and one of their friends told me about this place. When we had a family event on, and a few of us were in hong kong, I offered to try this place out. The family friend was so positive about this place and before we checked in I thought that it can't be that good - but it really is... The deal is that you stay in a stunning 5 star standard room for a very reasonable price. Its based on the 6th floor of a Chinese cookery school. The down sides are that it's about a 15 min drive into central hong kong and the staff are all in training. However, I would say the downsides are not that bad - there is a bus stop right outside and we never waited more than 3 mins for a bus to central. A bus to central is about 50 pence (gbp). The hotel are willing to order cabs but we did wait a while so it's just as quick to get the bus. Most of the time, we got a taxi back to the hotel - cost around 70 hkd (about £6 gbp) but its a good idea to have one of the hotel cards with you as a few taxi drivers were not aware of this facility. You have to be a bit patient with the staff as they are all in training, but what they lack in experience and confidence they make up for in eagerness, also I should say that there is always an experienced supervisor around so they step in when things may be taking a bit to long or they lay the cutlery out incorrectly for example. Other plus points are that the drinks in the mini bar, and at the bar, plus dinner are all very very reasonably priced. We had a bottle of wine for 88hkd (£7 gbp) - bet you wont find that in any other hotel, and there are some lovely sea views from the rooms and bar terrace. Another tip from someone who has been to hong kong a few times - the hotel is very near pokfulam country park, and there is a great walk up to the peak. Go to the park and at the gate, turn left up a big flight of stairs. At the top of the stairs bear right and you'll join a path. Follow the path round to you get to a road. Turn left and follow the road up to the peak. It's about an hour to hour and a half walk depending on your fitness.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: stenakt
Reviews.Content: This was a really great find. Exceptionally good value, about half the price of similar. Although the staff are training, they are competent and very keen to please. You won't get any attitude here. The rooms are superbly designed and extremely well equipped. Well-stocked mini-bar that you can actually use because the item prices are low. Good restaurant with, again, very reasonable prices, including the wine (an excellent bottle of Chardonnay was $15!). Great views from the Harbour view rooms. Well equipped gym. Slight downside is that it is away from the main Harbour, but that's only a 10 minute taxi ride (which is about $7). Close to the Stanley market (must see) and the jumbo restaurant (expensive and grumpy).

Reviews.Title: “awsome experience”
Reviews.Author: donCharly
Reviews.Content: The past month I spent 2 days in this hotel and I just want to share that this was a great value for money I payed. The staff was great and helpful, the views are amazing and the breakfast was very tasty. Everyone was courteous and very friendly, easy access from the airport. I would highly recommended and I will difinately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Paul593
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in March 2012. First tip when arriving, get the airport express train to Hong Kong Station, then a taxi. We bought tourist Octopus cards that included 2 single airport transfers plus all trains for any 3 consecutive days and you can add money to use on buses, ferries and lots of other stuff (dead simple, we are both over 60 and we managed it!!). Any money you add is refunded if not used. Tip2 print off the hotel info sheet, keep it with you as its invaluable to know which buses drop at the hotel. We arrived early and we got into the room no problem. We had an ocean view room, really nice, spotless, just as the pictures indicate. Mini bar is very cheap. We don't usually use it but we did here. The room was very quiet. Staff very helpful, obviously a little nervous and sometimes slower when carrying out tasks, but that doesn't detract from the experience. Tip 3 - book early for Friday dinner special, we didn't and it was fully booked. Breakfast was OK. Because they are dealing with relatively small numbers the buffet is not particularly well stocked and could be hotter but it is more than adequate. We tried to tip the person who brought our cases, but we're politely told that as it was a training hotel, they could not accept tips. The location might be an issue for some, but be advised the transport system is very efficient. We used mainly buses from the hotel to the centre (15 mins) and dont think we ever waited more than 3 or 4 minutes because there's a lot of options. When coming back on the bus, just remember to watch for a couple of blue Chinese Institute signs followed by a blue road sign with an exit signed to Pok Fu Lam and hit the bell. Central bus terminus is a good place to get the bus back because one stop is used for all the buses that pass the hotel (not M74). When leaving, book the complimentary hotel shuttle to HK station and check in there, including dropping cases. You can then carry on looking round HK if your flight isn't till later in the day. This was our first trip to HK, but if we ever return, we would definitely consider staying here. It was a real find. Tourist tips, big bus gives a good insight into the place. We found the weather clearer in the afternoon, so bear this in mind when doing the peak, which is a must. Sha Tin races was excellent, even on Derby day it was comfortable, but take your passport to get a tourist members badge (£15) , then you can sit (Yes sit!) in line with the finish line if you want to! Everyone likes different things, so your guide book will point you in the right direction. Talking of which we used the Time Out Guide book and found it very good. Whenever you go, have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous option in HK!”
Reviews.Author: Quax
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and it was a wonderful experience. Truly the best service we had in a long long time and the training staff are delightful - they can't do enough to help you and spoil you in every way possible. I think this is an excellent value for money and an unbelievable find for HK. Taxi to Central takes about 15 min and costs around $10 if you do not want to take pubic transport. The rooms are wonderful, quiet, well-decorated and with superbly comfy beds. It is also worth noting that this is the cleanest property that I have stayed in during this trip - others as a benchmark included Shangri-La, Mandarin, and 4 Seasons and none were as well cleaned as the T-Hotel. I hope the hotel continues to receive wonderful reviews! What a find...

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: CLBFC
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed here for 2 nights in Feb. We have always stayed on the mainland and found this location so much more peaceful and serene. The students will make you smile with their eagerness and friendliness, and always backed by a skilled and friendly supervisor. We enjoyed room service, the dining room and the wine. Rooms are as described and well decorated and equipped. Easy bus ride from the airport and back. We arranged a cab to go shopping and site seeing and it was inexpensive and easy. You just can't go wrong here, and a true break from the pace of the city. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “5*”
Reviews.Author: LB77756
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8.30am after an overnight flight but the staff let us check in to our room no problem. The room was really good, just what you'd expect from a place double the price or more. It's slightly strange staying in a college, which is rather unglamorous when you approach, but when you get up to the 6th floor you can tell no difference between being in a much larger luxury hotel. The staff are training so are not always going to get it right first time, but there are always supervising staff around who speak very good English if there are any problems. All staff are very friendly and helpful. Great terrace to have cocktails before dinner, looking out across the South China Sea, and because of the sharp slope you feel like you are much higher than the 6th floor. Excellent breakfast buffet and great gym. Overall great value for money. It is a little bit out of the centre but we found the buses really easy.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Guzel_S
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 nights in february 2012. Room is very big. was enough for my two-year old to run around :) Modern bathroom. The room has everything you might need including blowdrier, an iron and board, safe, tv etc. We were provided ( without request) with a baby bed, not too big, more appropriate for kids under 2. But my daughter fitted there. which And my daughter loved it. Although usually when we travel she prefers to sleep with us, every night and for the daytime nap she was asking to be put in it. The breakfast was good enough. and the view of the ocean is very nice. The staff quite helpfull. But as you know this hotel is for training personell, so do not expect 5 star service. And also do not expect them to give you correct answers on how to get around the city. They do not know it 99% of the time. But they provide you with free WiFi in the room, so just be prepared,get all the info online before you leave. Also if you see a manager you can ask thim. But nevert rely on a trainee's answer. Location of the hotel is pretty good. It has bus stop right in front with lots of buses stopping there going in any directiong you might chose. if you decide to take a taxi it will take about 15-20 minutes to go to Wan chai. And will cost you 75 Hong kong dollars. So overall the hotel it self is a 5star, but service is 3 star, although not because of negligence, but because they are on training. They really try to assist you the best they can.

Reviews.Title: “Just fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Kadd L
Reviews.Content: We heard of many good reviews about this hotel from friends and decided to give it a go. We stayed here recently for 3 weeks (Jan-Feb 2012) and found it absolutely fabulous. The room was hugh, even by western standard. Most of the staff attending to us were trainees (who are under constant supervision) and are eager to please. Service is just incredible. The managers are also very helpful, especially Jenny Chen, who would make sure our stay at the hotel was as comfortable as can be. On our last day, as our flight was in the evening, we were allowed late check-out at 5 pm without charge!! The location of the hotel was not a problem for us as we would spend the whole day in the city and not get back to the hotel till mid-night. There are lots of buses (the hotel will provide a list of buses) to the city centre and the fare is about HK$5.60 (US$0.75). Taxi fare is about HK$90(US$12). Bus journey to the city is only about 30 minutes. If you intend to stay more than a week in Hong Kong, it is better to get an "Octopus" card at the airport on arrival. You can use this card for all bus, metro and ferry, and also in supermarkets. We are very happy with T-Hotel and will defintely stay at this hotel again the next time we are in Hong Kong. KL&ML-Sydney

Reviews.Title: “stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: dieWelt1
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat hesitant to book here, given our uncertainty about staying at a "Training" Hotel. Thankfully we did stay here! The T Hotel is amazing value for the money. The rooms are very spacious (and not just by Hong Kong standards) and the rooms well appointed. There is a TV over the bath, for instance. The place has all the basic amenities like a (small) gym, a business center, and even a (training) spa. Many of the rooms have wonderful views of the harbor with giant container ships passing by. Sleep quality is excellent -- we never heard a thing from our neighbors, despite the hotel being full. The staff also tries to please. The trainees are overseen by exceptionally eager managers (and most of our contact was with them) who do things well and do them instantly. They were also kind enough to let us checkin several hours before official check-in time (despite a full hotel) and did their best to give us access to the room ASAP. Some many view the 10 minute taxi cab ride into the city central as a negative. It is true this adds to the cost of the hotel by about $10 each way. (There are cheaper options, like a free hotel shuttle into the city twice in the morning, as well as buses. The taxis took about 10 minutes to Central.) But even adding this cost to the hotel bill makes it infinitely cheaper than hotels with equal levels of comfort and service. (Our room charge was roughly $125 USD a night.) And this price includes breakfast with a variety of options including noodles, toast, fruit, cheese, cereal, yogurt, sliced meats, bacon, beans, and eggs made to order. While there, we spoke with several other guests who similarly couldn't believe what a great bargain this hotel was! Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rugratsfc
Reviews.Content: Everything people have been saying about the T Hotel is true. It is indeed amazing value for money, specially in HK. I have initially booked our whole family (7 adults + 3 children) in Ibis Hotel in Northpoint – but after looking at Trip Advisor reviews, decided to switch hotels. We spent 2 of our 4 night stay in HK in T Hotel (Dec 2011). The first 2 nights were spent in Disneyland Hotel – which is a beautiful hotel in itself (see my review for Disneyland Hotel), but quite expensive for A$320/room only/night. T hotel on the other hand, is only around HK$905 (A$ 120) for 2 adults/room/night and this rate includes buffet breakfast. We didn’t have any problems with checking in – it probably took around 20min to do that, but this is almost the same with other hotels, specially when you have to wait in a long line of guests checking in. Our hotel rooms were all surprisingly big, even better than what I’ve seen in the photos. The view from the room was just beautiful – even if we were just on the 6th floor (or 7th floor – I can’t remember), it seemed like we were on a higher floor with beautiful views of the sky and the sea. The bed was king sized and very comfortable. There was a sofa by the huge window, and a work desk which had everything a business traveller will need. The bathroom was also well appointed, with a separate bath tub and shower cubicle. I cannot tell you how much I detest having a shower over a bath tub –which is the normal practice for a lot of hotels to save on space and still be able to give you the option to use a tub. What I really loved was the TV inside the bathroom! The complimentary toiletries were also of good quality. And the minibar was more than reasonably priced – even cheaper than 7-11. As we arrived at the T Hotel past lunch time, we decided to have lunch in one of their two training restaurants. Was pleasantly surprised at how inexpensive the meals were – a bowl of beef noodle soup was only HK$40 (A$5.25), and their beef massaman curry (which was very good!) was only HK$60 (A$8). All other meals were priced similarly. All meals also come with a complimentary bread basket – which was baked fresh every day. I would have been happy just eating the bread. Getting to Central or the Kowloon area was easy enough, by catching a bus right in front of the complex. The hotel will give you a printed out guide for which bus to ride depending on your destination. Getting back however, has always been a problem for all of us – with either the bus not being in service at the time we try to get back to the hotel (if past 11pm, quite difficult). It is recommended to take a taxi from Central back to the hotel – it’s very convenient, and is only around HK$60-80 (A$8-10). On getting back to the hotel, we were all pleasantly surprised that we had a plate of chocolates, a bucket of ice and the bed has been turned down. It was a nice touch to their service. The breakfast, though limited in selection, was good. They have continental, asian and a hot selection of food to choose from. The pastries were quite good, similar to their bread. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to HK. The hotel is excellent value for money, and the staff, though still in training, are all very eager to please and would go out of their way to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. I've been to 5 countries just in December, travelling and doing touristy stuff, and this has been the best hotel I've stayed in for those trips.

Reviews.Title: “A true jewel and a great find”
Reviews.Author: catsandcool
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. You will only find it through trip advisor reviews as it is not advertised at all and is on none of the travel websites. I am in the hotel business and have stayed at five star hotels all over the world, as well as boutique hotels and everything in between. This hotel combines the best of a five star experience with that of a boutique experience. It is a training institute for the hospitality industry, so staffed by students, and you need to be patient. But they are enthusiastic and want to please. I congratulate the Hong Kong government for funding such an excellent idea and and the Director, Mr Tang, for the excellent work he and his team are doing. Stay here if you come to Hong Kong and get the Ocean view suite if available.

Reviews.Title: “More than just value for money”
Reviews.Author: Taridzo C
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to review hotels I stay in, but I just had to say something, this hotel was awesome! Frankly, because of my budget (perhaps), I had never stayed in a hotel where I got to watch my TV while I soak in the tub after a long day's thingummies. The checkin/checkout was quite smooth, way smoother than the Royal plazza hotel where I stayed the proceeding few nights. The trainee staff was very polite, and this was quite a welcome relief, given the hostile treatment I received a couple of months back at the San Francisco Travelodge (Airport North) by trained staff, so be warned and stay clear of the same. Anyway, I digress... The mini-bar was the most stocked I had ever seen, with lots of varieties. It gets better, the price of a can of soft-drinks (coke, 7up, sprite, etc) was HK$ 6, the same price as in the supermarket or corner store...how ridiculous is that, what hotel does that! There was also complimentary chocolate plate and ice cubes every day! The outside views were spectacular, the room design exquisite and roomy, with easy to use central control units for lighting and air-conditioning. The trainee staff will give their guests more attention than one might think possible, and this is not necessarily a good thing, but at the end of the day you feel good about helping the young youths through their training. They were so full of energy, promise and eager to go out there and change the world (tragically, been there done that :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: WishfulWanderlust
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this to anyone who's travelling to HK. The hotel set-up is elegant & breathtaking by itself, & the window view is an extra wow! The crib comforter is fluffy, not like other hotels that give you crib comforters that are obviously worn out thin. We've stayed at the 6/F for 3D/2N, & would go out from time to time to appreciate the rest of HK, but the minimal stay we had in the hotel gave a great lasting impression. If ever I would go back to HK, this is the ONLY option in my list. Best experienced yourself. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Willie S
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a hidden gem where not many have discovered it yet. Although this hotel is approximately 10-15 mins by taxi to and from Central Station, it is not at all difficult for the taxi driver to locate the place. The taxi ride costs approximately HK$60 one way and buses are aplently just outside the hotel. Apart from the slight downside on the location, the hotel is awesome. The room and toilet are spacious, clean and with lots of toiletries. The best part is that you are paying a small price for great sea view! Though some people may not be used to the excessive attention from the students, to me, this is better than people ignoring your presence. This hotel will definitely be my preferred choice whenever I am in HK again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olivier Z
Reviews.Content: This is my ever first hotel review, I tought this hotel really deserve a review, especially after staying 5 weeks. This hotel is cheaper than a service apartment and the service is excellent. The Staff are extremely nice, the food is nice, and it is a perfect place to relax after a manic day at work or a day shopping /walking in Kowloon . I will be coming back next year, for work, and i only want to stay in this place... A taxi ride to Wanchai or Central is about 15/20 minutes ( depending on traffic) and cost 60/70 HK .. If you take the bus in front is even cheaper.. but all depends if you are in a hurry or not ...I highly recommend this place if you are coming over to Hong Kong ...

Reviews.Title: “Many good news & only one not so good - fantastic value for money!”
Reviews.Author: nikosgeo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more or less the best hotel value in Hong Kong! First of all, the website of the hotel, so you can check it out or even book through it (which is recommended) is http://www.vtc.edu.hk/thotel/index.html. The reason that this hotel is much cheaper than similar others is that the hotel is run/operated by trainees of the Vocational Training College of Hong Kong (always under the supervision of experienced managers) as the whole organization is an educational institution for tourism! Before i'll give you the hotel facts so you can deside for yourself i'll have to inform you that by saying Hong Kong someone usually means, the whole area, which is the (rather small) island of Hong Kong and the bigger area which is called Kowloon. As you can easily imagine, the properties on the island of Hong Kong are way more expensive than the other ones. So, you have to deside where you want to stay as the hotels in Hong Kong island are expensive (as all of the properties over the island, for example the rent of a 2bedroom appartment costs about 3,500US$ per month) except this one, the T hotel, which has an average cost of 90euros or 120USD per night, including breakfast and an ocean view room ! Absolutely worth it ! The good news about the T hotel are, * Everything looks (and is) brand new. *Beatiful reception / entrance. Don't get fooled by the first look, the entrance area is inside the complex and it is very beatiful! *You will feel very welcome! Always! As the trainees are trying hard to do their best, you'll benefit from that - though sometimes it takes a bit more time (like 5-10mins more) for some standard proccedures like check in etc. *Safety, as there is 24hours guard for the whole complex and moreover the elevators are working only with card rooms - by the way i felt very safe in hong kong, there wasn't even the need to keep an eye for scams or something.. *Fantastic rooms - exactly as they look in their official site's photos! Big and VERY clean. Workstation with all the types of plugs (!), high speed internet (included / free). Big closets with enough space. Safety Box. Light control for the whole room near the bed. *VERY good sleep quality as the big bed, the matresses and the linens are high quality! These plus the variety of pillows means the you'll sleep great - which for me is the most important in a hotel. *Big bathroom with both options (!) a big modern shower and a bathtub. Very good quality and "fluffy" towels. *Every day room cleaning (sometimes twice a day). Small chocolates that you'll find nearby your bed after that plus two (or sometimes even 3 or 4 ) bottles of water - remember they are trying to do their best. *Whatever you ask for, after 2 mins there is a smiley trainee in front of your door ready to bring it to you! * Breakfast with great variety and quality. The view is awesome in the breakfast area! * Well equiped gym with treadmils and machines.It has towels and it's spacy and new! The not so good news: * It's location requires the use of a taxi for the Hong Kong center (10-15mins ride - about 5-7euros / 7-10US$) or a bus (30 mins total for waiting and transportation 1,1euro or 1,5$). All in all i totally recommend this hotel, you can save much money while enjoying the welcome feeling that you get all the time. Don't forget to get the bus A10 from the airport which will cost you only 4euros/6US$, 45mins ride. I forgot to take the bus (every 30') though it was very easy to go to the bus station and i took a taxi so i paid 430HKD, which is about 40euros or 55US$. Wasn't worth it for this one. Good luck in whatever you'll choose to do and have a great time in Hong Kong ! :o) Thanks for reading my review.

Reviews.Title: “A special place”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneBonnie
Reviews.Content: We are at the T Hotel now and we are enjoying it throughly. The rooms are very clean, and modern and have everything I feel you could ask for in a hotel room. You must understand this is a training hotel and all the young staff here are in training so your patience & understanding is required but it is a wonderful experience,from the detailed turn down service at nite, to the delicious food in the restaurant I am so glad we chose this special place in Hong Kong! Did I mention the amazing views here! You book through the hotel website thotel@vtc.edu.hk

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Hong Kong!!”
Reviews.Author: valtripadv
Reviews.Content: T-hotel is located at Pokfulam, from the airport you can take Bus A10 to the hotel. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel and It only take 20-30mins to reach Central or Mongkok. A cab ride to Peak tram will cost around HK$70. Don't be put off by the outside appearance of the hotel, T-Hotel is actually a very chic and modern hotel run by Vocational Training College of Hong Kong. The hotel rooms, restaurant, gym and business centre are all located on the 6th floor of VTC. As T-hotel is run by trainees in the college, check-in/ check-out might take around 15-20 mins but the trainees show very good effort and enthusiasm to help you with the luggage and show you around the room - which is very rare. The size of the room is big if you compare it with a 4/5-star hotel in Hong Kong. Room is chic and modern, bed super comfortable and bed sheets are very clean - not even a single stain! There is a walk in shower and a bath with TV in the bathroom and the hotel provides you with loads of toiletries - there is even a bath scrub provided. The mini-bar is very well stock and a can of coke cost only HK$6! Complimentary wifi is provided by the hotel. What I like most is the attentiveness provided by T-hotel. Everyday when I went back to the hotel, there will always be a bucket of ice and a plate of cookies and chocolates placed on the table! The best part is it only cost HK$745nett per night for a room with ocean view!

Reviews.Title: “very good place in HK”
Reviews.Author: popoaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: this hotel is school training hotel, so don t expect so much but still for the price you fell like you are in 4 star hotel. Student take care of you to well there is the problem but well i can adapt... so yes staff make mistake but it is great if you can past it but at 850 hkd a night not a big dill. the worst is the location but the view is fabulous. if you don't care payed 60khd for taxi it is a place i recommend to stay in HK

Reviews.Title: “Service with heart”
Reviews.Author: ruadocampo
Reviews.Content: This is a training hotel and you are served by students in training. There might be a few hiccups here and there but you can see that they are devoted to the job and serve wholeheartedly. A refreshing break from robotic service that you see elsewhere. Don't worry -- they are monitored by experienced trainers and the overall experience is exceptional. The only catch is that the location is a bit out of the way. Make use of the bus stop right in front of the hotel as calling a taxi may take longer than waiting for the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Plesantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Migii_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I recently heard about this new property from a friend of mine who is a member of their club so I decided it was a great opporunity to try something new considering I was in Hong Kong for a vacation. My friend said that the hotel was actually trainee operated so with this in mind, my partner and I decided to take a tour of the property (in case it wasn't for us). Tours of the property are readily available and after one lunch at the Chinese restaurant on the premises, we decided to participate in the tour. It was fairly quick and brief but it was enough to see the main facilities in the property which were the executive lounge, two room types, gym and business centre. We were told on the tour that the property is a training facility and that it is operated mainly by students with little supervision. Why I have to state this is because if you plan on staying, I think it's best you know (and I will explain later the repercussions of having students organize and prepare everything). My partner and I decided to take the plunge and give it a try and since the room rates were more than reasonable (HKD $550 for a Saturday night in an Ocean View Room including buffet breakfast for two!) we thought we had nothing to lose. We arrived on the following Saturday and was delighted to be greeted by the trainees in a loud and clear manner. We were rather impressed at the professionalism however it may be deemed slightly intimidating as there were 5 student porters on each side of the front door and as you walk in, they all greet you in unison. The room was absolutely stunning! Complete views of South China Sea, television in the bathroom, large soft king size bed; I was truly impressed. I guess you could say that I was slightly iffy about the place because of the fact it is a ‘training’ hotel but the room itself was really good. It was also good because it was around 4PM so the sun was still up and we were able to see the sunset. I guess the main issues with it being a ‘training’ facility is that there tends to be an abundance of students, very willingly of course to assist you but it tends to be overwhelming from time to time. For example, during my buffet breakfast we were served by 4 students which is nice but for me was a tad too much because I am not much of a morning person. Another issue is that the security to the building is rather tight. I decided to venture out at night and came back to be questioned by the security twice if I was a guest at the hotel and one of the guards even followed me until he saw me walk through the lobby. Not saying that there was anything wrong with the safety but I felt a little bit of pressure. Overall, I would say to give it a try. I understand that they are in a soft opening period at the moment so there are still many things that need to be tweaked but it was a lovely experience and it was fantastic to enjoy a decently made coffee in Hong Kong whilst looking over the ocean. It’s worth trying out because at the end of the day, it was definitely value for money, the service is pleasant, the room is gorgeous (I must reiterate this!) and the coffee is fantastic! (In comparison to all the other coffee places I’ve tried in HK!) I hope this helps! I know this is quite lengthy but my partner wanted to contribute. =)

HotelInfo.Name: The T Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6th Floor, VTC Pokfulam Complex,145 Pokfulam Road, Hong Kong, China
